title: Vander Decken's Obsession Was About Ancient Weapon Poseidon, Not Love
summary: Fans theorize that Vander Decken IX's obsession with Shirahoshi was never about genuine romantic feelings, but rather about the fabled power his family had been searching for - the Ancient Weapon Poseidon.
fullText: Vander Decken IX's family, the Vander Decken lineage, had been searching for something on Fish-Man Island for generations. When Decken discovered that Shirahoshi had inherited the power to command Sea Kings (the Ancient Weapon Poseidon), his 'love' became an obsession to possess that power. His proposal in Episode 537 reveals the possessive nature of his feelings - he wants to control her, not be with her as an equal partner. The fact that he immediately switches to wanting to kill her when rejected proves his feelings were never about her happiness or wellbeing, but about obtaining the power she represents. This makes Decken's character a commentary on those who pursue relationships for power and control rather than genuine connection.

title: Shirahoshi's Rejection Shows Her Mother's Influence
summary: Fans theorize that Shirahoshi's polite but firm rejection of Vander Decken in Episode 537 demonstrates the values and strength her mother Queen Otohime instilled in her, despite her fearful nature.
fullText: Despite being terrified and locked in Hard-Shell Tower for ten years because of Vander Decken's threats, Shirahoshi finds the courage to reject him when he proposes. She doesn't give in to fear or accept him to save her life - she stands up for herself and her right to choose. This mirrors her mother Queen Otohime's philosophy of standing up for what's right and choosing the path of honesty over convenience. Even though Shirahoshi is portrayed as timid and crying frequently, this moment shows she inherited her mother's inner strength. Her choice of words - 'you're not my type' - is both polite (like Otohime taught her to be) and firm (refusing to be controlled by fear). This moment foreshadows Shirahoshi's later development into a braver person who can face her fears.
author: Fish-Man Island Arc Analysis Community

title: Luffy's Jet Hammer Foreshadows His Later Gear Techniques
summary: The debut of Gomu Gomu no Jet Hammer in Episode 537 demonstrates Luffy's evolving combat creativity and foreshadows his later development of even more advanced Gear techniques.
fullText: Gomu Gomu no Jet Hammer represents Luffy taking an existing technique (Gomu Gomu no Ozuchi/Mallet) and enhancing it with Gear Second. This pattern of evolving and combining his techniques shows Luffy's growth as a fighter. The fact that he can use this technique effectively while tied up demonstrates his adaptability and combat intelligence. Fans theorize this creative approach to technique development foreshadows his later innovations with Gear Fourth (combining techniques with Haki) and eventually Gear Fifth. The episode shows that Luffy's true strength isn't just raw power but his ability to adapt his Devil Fruit abilities to any situation, a theme that continues throughout the series.
